# hv_vcpu_run(_:)

**Function**

Starts the execution of a vCPU.

## Declaration

```swift
func hv_vcpu_run(_ vcpu: hv_vcpuid_t) -> hv_return_t
```

## Parameters

- **vcpu**: The instance of the vCPU.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_SUCCESS] if the operation was successful, otherwise an error code specified in [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_return_t].

## Discussion

Call blocks until the next exit of the vCPU. The owning thread must call this function.

On an Apple Silicon, if the exit is of type [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_EXIT_REASON_VTIMER_ACTIVATED], the VTimer is automatically masked. As a result, no timer fires until the timer is unmasked with [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_vcpu_set_vtimer_mask(_:_:)].

On an Intel-based Mac, [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_vcpu_run(_:)] exits from causes external to the guest. To avoid the overhead of spurious exits use [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_vcpu_run_until(_:_:)] with the deadline [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_DEADLINE_FOREVER].

## Runtime

- **hv_vcpus_exit(_:_:)**: Forces an immediate exit of a set of vCPUs of the VM.
- **hv_vcpu_get_pending_interrupt(_:_:_:)**: Gets pending interrupts for a vCPU.
- **hv_vcpu_set_pending_interrupt(_:_:_:)**: Sets pending interrupts for a vCPU.
- **hv_vcpu_get_exec_time(_:_:)**: Returns, by reference, the cumulative execution time of a vCPU, in nanoseconds.
- **hv_interrupt_type_t**: The type that defines the vCPU’s interrupts.
- **Exits**: Describe virtual machine exit conditions.
